context: In a recent attempt to move laterally within our network, a user account associated with Grace Chen (email: Grace Chen@vnevado.alpineskihouse.co) had its attempts to modify files over server message block (SMB) protocol blocked by an automated attack disruption. This incident is part of a broader security concern involving possible attempts to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT), which is a crucial artifact for Azure AD authentication on various devices.
question: Can you determine the IP address from which the possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) was made?
solution_steps: An attempt to create, delete, or modify files over the SMB protocol was blocked on the device with AadDeviceId `e5799261-6720-4297-961e-bd9ca4275033`.
A possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) using the process `browsercore.exe` was detected.
A possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) was detected from IP address `107.224.99.179`.
